results.title: Hard rubbish
results.brief_description:
A look at everyday life in one community and how it transforms waste into a valuable commodity, from one individual’s discarded object to another’s newly claimed prize possession. Several residents offer their personal insights to curbside recycling or as one discerning person calls it “free-ranging rubbish”, adding that there is a definite rubbish etiquette to be followed.
Music composed and performed by Irma Frieda.

results.title: Emu
results.brief_description: ‘Emu’ is a single-take short film depicting the inquisitive desperation of two emus as they wander through the contemporary urban environment of Broken Hill, NSW. Shot during the 2000s Australian drought, the viewer observes the pace of ‘emu time’ while the two animals are searching for water. An original music score accompanies the footage, created and edited by Sean O’Keeffe.

results.title: Trades Hall, Carlton: the early years
results.brief_description: Interviewee Paddy Garritty, Union Promotions, provides a brief historical picture of the early beginnings of the Trades Hall building in Carlton, in inner Melbourne. He talks about the origins of the Eight-Hour Day, the Trade Union movement and the establishment of the Trades Hall Council (a central hall for the skilled trades movement set up by the Freemasons) and the visions of this Hall as a facilitator for education, health and the arts for the working class. Interviewer: Leesa Carriage.

results.title: Vert bleu terre = Green blue ground
results.brief_description: A rather amusing and quirky animated claymation film about two worms, one green and the other blue, trying to outsmart each other over an apple.

results.title: The World is our sound toy
results.creator_credit: Dylan Davis and Swinburne University of Technology
results.brief_description:
The sound toys presented in this interactive work create a computing experience that extends the imagination not only in a musical sense but in the way we perceive the world around us. They explore the nature musical software, the use of the environment as musical instruments and look to explore a musical interpretation of the environment around us. The sound toys and the inspiration behind each one include:
The Leaf blower - the desire to turn the day-to-day noise pollution into musical instruments
The Bird chorus - waiting for the tram at the bottom of Elizabeth St. As I looked up at all the birds on the cables, they sat in a set of patterns that lent itself to a musical sequence
The Sea gulls - watching the seagulls descend on the MCG 30 minutes before the final whistle
Windows - peering in office windows and trying to imagine what is going on inside
Telegraph lines - driving to Sydney on the Hume Highway
Jam tarts - old analogue sequences. the jam tart image is from historic Gundagai, from the old bakery there
Palm leaf - camping in Mungo Brush National park in New South Wales
Big poles - cloudy rainy day at Mungo Brush National Park, staring at the ducks and the poles in the water
Ghoulies - accurately time mapped, thus allowing a BPM counter

results.title: Greyn - "Beckher"
results.brief_description:
This experimental music video was developed for Melbourne art-rock band, Greyn, with the assistance of the Australian Council for the Arts. A non-commercial film, it breaks down the generic film conventions of commercial music video production by not promoting the band as sexy, as rock gods, or as exceptional musicians, but by telling the story of inner balance.
The two performers, Sangeetha Jane and Daimon Barry, move through an experimental yoga/dance sequence that sees them grow and evolve over the course of a hauntingly beautiful track entitled “Beckher”.
(No title or credits)

results.title: Living in the dark
results.brief_description:
Using 2-D animation this short film captures the filmmaker’s childhood experience of an eye injury which not only caused a temporary loss of sight and distortion of vision, but also a sense of fear and loneliness. His father too suffered a similar fate as a child but circumstances were such that he became permanently blind. The story explores family relationships and reflects on life’s unexpected turns. Narrated by Roberto Salvatore.

“Living in the dark” recently won the best cinematography in the 2005 Bondi Short Film Festival in Sydney and was selected for the Electronic Theatre Program at the Graphite 2005 Conference, Dunedin, New Zealand.

results.title: My grandmother
results.creator_credit: Elizabeth Leek and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Elizabeth lived with her grandmother in a little village in Sudan. This story is a dedication to her grandmother, a woman who taught her many things.

results.title: Director's cut
results.creator_credit: Stephanie Moore and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Stephanie reflects on her time as director of Positive Women, a support and advocacy organisation for women with HIV. She is inspired by the courage of the women who must come to terms with a disease that can kill them or significantly reduce their quality of life.
